radiographic_examinations.findings: Calcified granuloma (measuring 3 mm in diameter) in the right upper lobe and multiple pulmonary emboli involving the main, lobar, segmental, and subsegmental pulmonary arteries bilaterally.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Nonocclusive thrombus in the right renal vein, wall thickening of the gastric antrum and proximal small bowel, multiple enlarged mesenteric lymph nodes, mild mesenteric edema, and evidence of small-volume ascites.
